adjectives.description: gendered (comparative more gendered, superlative most gendered)

entries.meaning: (linguistics, of a language) Having grammatical gender.
examples: Grammatically, Hebrew is a gendered language because every noun is either masculine or feminine.

entries.meaning: Pertaining to gender or having attributes due to gender.

examples: In the past, parenting was a more gendered activity with more distinct male and female roles.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of gender (“assign gender to”)
(archaic) simple past tense and past participle of gender (“engender”)
examples: "...or some hidden Spermatick power has gendered these both Anchors, Urnes, Coins, and Sculls in the ground...
